alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 12:27AM PDT until August 26 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Inyo County in south central California... * Until 200 AM PDT. * At 1227 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms were diminishing across Death Valley but earlier rainfall amounts between 0.5 and 1 inch will likely keep the threat of flash flooding ongoing until at least 2 am PDT. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... SR190 near Furnace Creek and SR127 from Death Valley Junction to Shoshone. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
